layout.title: gossr + Vue SSR minimal
layout.subtitle: Rendered by Go, hydrated by Vue.
common.field.title: title
page.home.title: Home
page.hiGopher.title: Hi gopher
page.hiVue.title: Hi Vue
page.noFetch.title: No SSR fetch page
page.noFetch.desc: This page sets meta.ssrData=false, so client navigation will skip /__ssr_fetch.
page.seo.title: SEO Head Demo
page.seo.tip: Refresh then inspect page source or DevTools to verify head tags are SSR-injected.
page.session.title: Session Cookie Demo
page.protected.title: Protected page
page.protected.desc: This page requires authentication. Unauthenticated users will be redirected to Session demo.
page.slow.title: Slow SSR Fallback Demo
page.slow.desc1: This route intentionally waits 3.5s on server side, exceeding gossr default 3s SSR timeout.
page.slow.desc2: Open this URL in a new tab to observe fallback first, then client-side recovery.
page.slowFetch.title: Slow __ssr_fetch Demo
page.slowFetch.desc1: This route intentionally waits 3.5s in backend __ssr_fetch handler.
page.slowFetch.desc2: It simulates slow payload fetching. Unlike /slow-ssr, it should not trigger SSR timeout fallback.
page.slowFetch.tip: Use this command to observe fetch latency directly:
page.notFound.title: 404 Not Found
page.notFound.desc: Page does not exist. Please check the URL.
